result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Poindexter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Straight time. After 40 days, the balance may be served with Huber.
5 days credit granted, if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CM313
Probation may be served in Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Remaining bail APPLIED OF $157.00. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No violent contact with the victim.
Domestic Abuse counseling through a State Certified batterers intervention program and/or Anger Management Counseling.
Case 15CM1000 was dismissed and read into: 15CM464 and 15CM313.
